sen.j: 宗形 清氏（むなかた の きようじ）は日本の皇族で、宗像大社（現在の福岡県宗像市）の初代大宮司。
sen.e: MUNAKATA no Kiyouji was a member of Japanese Imperial family who was the first chief priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
MUNAKATA no Kiyouji was a member of the Japanese Imperial family who was the first chief priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
MUNAKATA no Kiyouji (宗形 清氏) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family who was the first chief priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Imperial Familyとしました。後述で、異なる漢字での名前についてふれるので、ここにも漢字を追加しました。

sen.j: 宇多天皇の皇子で官位は正三位中納言の後、延喜14年(914年)に宗像神社の宮司となる。
sen.e: He was a prince of the Emperor Uda and after being conferred the court rank of Shosanmi (Senior third rank) Chunagon (middle councilor of state), he became the priest of Munakata-taisha shrine in 914.
He was the prince of Emperor Uda and after being conferred the court rank of Shosanmi (Senior third rank) Chunagon (middle councilor of state), he became the priest of Munakata-taisha shrine in 914.
He was the prince of Emperor Uda and after being conferred the court rank of Shosanmi (Senior third rank) Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), he became the priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine in 914.
sen.cmt: 中納言→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state)としました。

sen.j: 光遠親王、宗像清氏、清氏親王とも。
sen.e: He was also called Imperial Prince Koen, Munakata no Kiyouji or Imperial Prince Kiyouji.
He was also called Imperial Prince Koen, Munakata no Kiyouji or Imperial Prince Kiyouji.
He was also called Imperial Prince Koen, MUNAKATA no Kiyouji (宗像清氏) or Imperial Prince Kiyouji.
sen.cmt: 宗像清氏 を追加しました。

sen.j: 子孫は大宮司職を世襲する。
sen.e: His descendants successively inherited the post of chief priest.
His descendants successively inherited the post of chief priest.
His descendants successively inherited the post of chief priest.
He had some children including Ujio MUNAKATA.
He had some children including Ujio MUNAKATA.
He had some children including Ujio MUNAKATA.

sen.j: 清氏ははじめ光遠親王といい、宗像神社宮司に就任した際に宗形清氏と改名したとされる。
sen.e: Kiyouji was initially called Imperial Prince Koen and he renamed himself MUNAKATA no Kiyouji when he assumed the position of the chief priest of Munakata-taisha shrine.
Kiyouji was initially called Imperial Prince Koen and he renamed himself MUNAKATA no Kiyouji when he assumed the position of the chief priest of Munakata-taisha shrine.
Kiyouji was initially called Imperial Prince Koen and he renamed himself MUNAKATA no Kiyouji when he assumed the position of the chief priest of Munakata-taisha Shrine.
sen.cmt: Shrine と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 出自について宇多天皇の末子とも、第4子とも、また弟という説があり、宮司就任が914年と天皇と同時代であることは窺える。
sen.e: He is said to have been either the youngest son, the fourth son or a younger brother of the Emperor Uda, but we can gather at least that he lived in the same era with the Emperor from the fact that he became the head priest in 914.

He is said to have been either the youngest son, the fourth son, or a younger brother of Emperor Uda, but we can gather at least that he lived during the same era with the Emperor from the fact that he became head priest in 914.

He is said to have been either the youngest son, the fourth son, or a younger brother of Emperor Uda, but we can gather at least that he lived during the same era with the Emperor from the fact that he became head priest in 914.

sen.j: ただし、宗形清氏という人物が10世紀初頭にいたとしても、そのような人物が皇族であったわけではない。
sen.e: However, even though a person called MUNAKATA no Kiyouji was in existence in the early 10th century, it doesn’t mean he was a member of Imperial family.
However, even though a person called MUNAKATA no Kiyouji was in existence during the early 10th century, it doesn’t mean he was a member of the Imperial family.
However, even though a person called MUNAKATA no Kiyouji was in existence during the early 10th century, it doesn't mean he was a member of the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: Imperial Familyとしました。二バイト文字を修正し、カンマを ' に変更しました。

sen.j: したがって宇多天皇の皇子で正三位中納言であったというのは全くの創作であり、論ずるに足りない。
sen.e: Therefore, the story that he was a prince and Shosanmi Chunagon is a mere fiction and is not worth consideration.
Therefore, the story about him being a prince and Shosanmi Chunagon is a merely fiction and is not worth consideration.
Therefore, the story about him being a prince and Shosanmi Chunagon is a merely fiction and is not worth consideration.
